Asunto: Re: [junit] How to test a main(String[] args) method?


>So said David on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>Dear Members,
>
>I whould like to test a class with a main(String[] args) method.
Depending
>on the input argument it executes one thing or the other. The problem is
>that on my main(String[] args) method at the end or when it founds an
>error,
>the method System.exit() is invoked. So when I define jUnit test cases
>(methods with prefix test), jUnits only runs the first test, because some
>System.exit() was invoked.
>
>Is there any way to test such kind of situations?

1. Do not use System.exit().
2. If you must use System.exit():

- Create a new method on your class called go(String[] args) {...}
- Move code from main() into go(), but leave the System.exit() call in
main()
- Change main() to call go()
- Test go(); not main()
[David Leal] It does't work for my case, because I don't invoke exit(),
only at the end, depending on the input value I have exit(-1), exit(0), in a
different bifurcation, of my original main(String[]) code.

[David Leal] I think the best solution was propoused by Bern:

java.lang.System is final and does not implement interfaces,
so there is no chance to replace ist behaviour.

You may want to replace calls to System.exit() with calls against
an interface you define. Under test use an implementation which allows
your
test code to chech if the exit method has been called by main() but which
does not exit the VM. In production use an implememtation which delegates
to

System.exit().

Bernd

Thanks,

David
